definition:
[**Definition.**]{} Let $A=(a_{ij})$ be a $n\times n$ matrix and let $B$
be a $m\times m$ matrix. Then the *Kronecker product* of $A$ and $B$ is
the $mn\times mn$ block matrix $$\begin{aligned}
A\otimes B &=&\left( \begin{array}{ccc} 
a_{11} B & \cdots & a_{1n} B \\
\vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
a_{n1} B & \cdots & a_{nn} B \\
\end{array} \right).\end{aligned}$$ The Kronecker product is also known
as the *direct product* or the *tensor product* [@eves].

[**Fundamental properties**]{} [@eves; @kailath]

1.  The product is bilinear. If $k$ is a scalar, and $A,B$ and $C$ are
    square matrices, such that $B$ and $C$ are of the same order, then
    $$\begin{aligned}
    A\otimes (B+C) &=& A\otimes B + A\otimes C,\\ 
    (B+C)\otimes A &=& B\otimes A + C\otimes A,\\
    k(A\otimes B) &=& (kA)\otimes B = A\otimes (kB).\end{aligned}$$

2.  If $A,B,C,D$ are square matrices such that the products $AC$ and
    $BD$ exist, then $(A\otimes B)(C\otimes D)$ exists and
    $$\begin{aligned}
    (A\otimes B)(C\otimes D) &=& AC\otimes BD.\end{aligned}$$ If $A$ and
    $B$ are invertible matrices, then $$\begin{aligned}
    (A\otimes B)^{-1} &=& A^{-1} \otimes B^{-1}.\end{aligned}$$

3.  If $A$ and $B$ are square matrices, then for the transpose ($A^T$)
    we have $$\begin{aligned}
    (A\otimes B)^{T} &=& A^{T} \otimes B^{T}.\end{aligned}$$

4.  Let $A$ and $B$ be square matrices of orders $n$ and $m$,
    respectively. If $\{\lambda_i | i=1,\ldots,n \}$ are the eigenvalues
    of $A$ and $\{\mu_j | j=1,\ldots, m \}$ are the eigenvalues of $B$,
    then $\{\lambda_i \mu_j |  i=1,\ldots, n, \, j=1,\ldots, m \}$ are
    the eigenvalues of $A\otimes B$. Also, $$\begin{aligned}
    \det (A\otimes B) &=& (\det A)^m (\det B)^n, \\
    {\mathop{\mathrm{rank}}}(A\otimes B) &=& {\mathop{\mathrm{rank}}}A\, {\mathop{\mathrm{rank}}}B, \\
    {\mathop{\mathrm{trace}}}(A\otimes B) &=& {\mathop{\mathrm{trace}}}A\, {\mathop{\mathrm{trace}}}B, \\\end{aligned}$$

[9]{} H. Eves, *Elementary Matrix Theory*, Dover publications, 1980. T.
Kailath, A.H. Sayed, B. Hassibi, *Linear estimation*, Prentice Hall,
2000
